commits.content:
# lesson â€” React + Vite Project âš›ï¸

A fast, minimal React application scaffolded with Vite. This project is configured for modern development with ESLint, React 19, and Vite's fast dev server and build pipeline.

---

## Table of Contents

- [About](#about)
- [Features](#features)
- [Prerequisites](#prerequisites)
- [Quick Start](#quick-start)
- [Available Scripts](#available-scripts)
- [Project Structure](#project-structure)
- [Linting & Type Checking](#linting--type-checking)
- [Deployment](#deployment)
- [Contributing](#contributing)
- [License](#license)

---

## About

This repository contains a small React application using Vite for development and bundling. It is intended as a starting point for learning or building small-to-medium React apps with a modern toolchain.

## Features âœ…

- React 19 with modern JSX transform
- Vite dev server with fast Hot Module Replacement (HMR)
- ESLint setup (recommended rules + React Hooks rules)
- TypeScript type definitions available (via `@types/react`) for gradual adoption

## Prerequisites ğŸ”§

- Node.js v18+ (recommended)
- npm (or yarn/pnpm)

## Quick Start â€” Local Development ğŸš€

1. Install dependencies:

```bash
npm install
# or
# yarn
# pnpm install
```

2. Start the dev server:

```bash
npm run dev
```

3. Open http://localhost:5173 in your browser.

## Available Scripts ğŸ“¦

- `npm run dev` â€” Run development server with HMR
- `npm run build` â€” Create a production build in `dist/`
- `npm run preview` â€” Locally preview the production build
- `npm run lint` â€” Run ESLint across the project

## Project Structure ğŸ“

```
/ (project root)
â”œâ”€ public/                # static assets
â”œâ”€ src/                   # application source
â”‚  â”œâ”€ assets/             # images, icons, etc.
â”‚  â”œâ”€ App.jsx
â”‚  â”œâ”€ main.jsx
â”‚  â””â”€ index.css
â”œâ”€ index.html
â”œâ”€ package.json
â”œâ”€ eslint.config.js       # ESLint configuration
â”œâ”€ vite.config.js
â””â”€ README.md
```

## Linting & Type Checking ğŸ”

- ESLint is configured in `eslint.config.js`. Run `npm run lint` to check for issues.
- This project includes type declarations (`@types/react`) so you can introduce TypeScript gradually.

> Tip: For full TypeScript support, consider migrating files to `.tsx` and adding a `tsconfig.json`.

## Deployment ğŸŒ

Build for production:

```bash
npm run build
```

The optimized build is output to `dist/`, which you can serve with any static hosting provider (Netlify, Vercel, GitHub Pages, etc.).

## Contributing ğŸ¤

Contributions are welcome. Please follow these guidelines:

- Open an issue to discuss larger changes before coding.
- Use clear, focused commits and provide a descriptive PR title.
- Ensure linting passes before submitting a PR (`npm run lint`).

## License

This project is available under the MIT license. Replace this with your chosen license if different.

---

If you'd like, I can add a short demo screenshot, CI configuration (e.g., GitHub Actions), or a `CONTRIBUTING.md` to the repo. ğŸ’¡
